entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025: Guidance to Ease Your Transition to SAP Cloud ERP Private
entry.content:
A couple of words about me: 

My name is Matthias Stegmueller and I‚Äôm driving the product development for SAP‚Äôs Business Data Transformation Center as Lead Product Owner. My focus is to accelerate cloud transitions through SAP‚Äôs Transformation Portfolio, enabling business transformation via a unified methodology.

My Session: DT103 ‚Äì Guidance to Ease Your Transition to SAP Cloud ERP Private

 üìÖ Wednesday, Nov 5    ‚è≤ 4:15 PM - 5:00 PM CET

 

What you will learn about: 

Transitioning to SAP Cloud ERP Private can be complex‚Äîbut it doesn‚Äôt have to be. In this session, J√∂rg and me will guide you through the available transition paths, including New Implementation, System Conversion, and Selective Data Transition. You‚Äôll explore how SAP‚Äôs Business Transformation Center and integrated toolchain support a smooth, data-driven journey with minimal disruption. Learn how to leverage tools like the Digital Blueprint, System Transition Workbench, and Data Transition Validation to accelerate your move while reducing risk and cost. Whether you're a customer or a partner, this session offers practical insights, demos, and best practices to help you confidently navigate your cloud ERP transformation.

 Co-speakers: 

 @joerg_marenk 

Other related sessions I recommend:  

DT264 | How to start transitioning to SAP Cloud ERP Private
ST103 | Accelerating the cloud transition with a guided transition methodology
CS102 | Speed up your cloud transition: Maximize efficiency and minimize costs
CS162 | Data-driven transition guidance toward the cloud
CS803 | A journey through next-generation transformation tools

Related community topic pages: 

 SAP Business Transformation Center

 Looking forward to seeing you: 

 Don't miss the chance to learn how to secure your organization online services as well as your online customers accounts from malicious actors.  Register now and be part of these sessions

 Now let‚Äôs hear from you: 

  • Did you start your journey to SAP Cloud ERP Private already? What are your current observations and challenges and expectation towards SAP to accelerate it? 
  • Which transition path did you choose (if already) and why?

Feel free to answer these questions by adding a comment in the comments section. Looking forward to hearing from you!

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025: AI agent hub: how to discover and control all your AI agents
entry.content:
A couple of words about me:

My name is Michelle and I am a senior product manager at SAP LeanIX with 5+ years expertise in ideating, positioning and driving enterprise SaaS adoption across the entire product lifecycle. I know firsthand how to distinguish between what customers want and truly need, both from my background in product and product marketing ‚Äìand as a mother of a toddler.

My session:

BTM100 | AI agent hub: How to discover and control all your AI agents

Nov 5 (Wednesday) 3:15 PM - 4:00 PM CET
 
What you will learn about:

AI agents are multiplying fast ‚Äî forecasts point to billions within a few years ‚Äî and enterprises already face shadow agents, duplication, unclear ownership, and projects that never deliver business value. For developers, consultants, and enterprise architects, the technical challenge is less about models and more about discovery, governance, and measurable outcomes.

What we‚Äôll cover:

  • Why ‚Äúdiscover and control‚Äù is now a first-class enterprise concern
  • How the agent hub gives visibility across platforms and providers without vendor lock-in
  • Practical patterns: agent registries, approved-agent portals, adoption radars, and executive dashboards that help you track the adoption progress of agentic AI

Co-speakers:

@DominikRose, SVP Product SAP LeanIX

Looking forward to seeing you:

Sign up and get ready to rethink how your org discovers and controls agents before the ‚Äúshadow crowd‚Äù becomes unmanageable.

Now let‚Äôs hear from you:

Where do you build agents, and how will you govern them?

entry.title: Shaping the Future of SAP Cloud ALM: Join My Sessions at SAP TechEd in Berlin
entry.content:
At SAP TechEd 2025 in Berlin, I‚Äôm excited to lead two sessions that dive deep into how SAP Cloud ALM is evolving into an intelligent, autonomous platform that redefines how organizations manage their SAP landscapes. 

If you‚Äôre guiding your company‚Äôs cloud transformation or planning your move from SAP Solution Manager to SAP Cloud ALM, these sessions are for you. 

Before I share what I'm going to present about in SAP TechEd Berlin, I would like to share with you some background information. 

 

SAP‚Äôs ALM strategy and vision 

Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) is the backbone of enterprise IT, orchestrating the full lifecycle of applications - from design and build, through migration and service delivery, to ongoing operations. 

SAP‚Äôs vision is to evolve SAP Cloud ALM into a transformation execution platform, supporting the full lifecycle: Scope, Build, Migrate, and Run.  

With the new ‚ÄúScope‚Äù pillar, SAP Cloud ALM will become the central scoping hub by integrating results from the Digital Discovery Assessment (to speed up projects by re-using assessment data), the SAP Readiness Check (to include simplification items), Best Practice Guidance coming from SAP Signavio and information from the Landscape Discovery. 

In ‚ÄúBuild‚Äù, we plan to strengthen the integration between SAP Signavio and SAP Cloud ALM, and further enrich the existing capabilities of SAP Cloud ALM for process and project management, testing, and deployment management. 

With the also new ‚ÄúMigrate‚Äù pillar, we combine and enhance offerings to support customers with data migration for their cloud transformation projects, as well as integrating Custom Code Management capabilities and adding rollout and template management to support large-scale enterprise transformations. 

For the ‚ÄúRun‚Äù pillar, SAP plans to move towards autonomous ALM in three steps - from leveraging AI in Integration Monitoring, Health Monitoring, and Business Process Monitoring, through agentic AI use cases to fully autonomous ALM for implementation, powered by embedded AI and Joule agents. 

 

What will I cover at SAP TechEd 2025? 

At SAP TechEd, I am going to cover two different aspects of our ALM strategy: First, I will dive into our plans on leveraging AI in SAP Cloud ALM, and second I will lay out the roadmap of SAP Cloud ALM from an innovation persopective. 

 

Session 1: Strategy for SAP Cloud ALM with Autonomous ALM and Joule 

Session ID: ST106 
When: Tuesday, Nov. 4, 10:15am 

How can artificial intelligence revolutionize the way we manage SAP landscapes? In this strategy session, we‚Äôll explore SAP‚Äôs vision for autonomous ALM using SAP Cloud ALM ‚Äî powered by Joule, SAP‚Äôs generative AI copilot. 

You‚Äôll learn how AI agents can proactively identify and resolve operational issues, reducing manual intervention and ensuring continuous, automated system reliability. We‚Äôll also discuss SAP‚Äôs roadmap toward a fully autonomous ALM future ‚Äî where human oversight shifts from problem-solving to strategic innovation. 

 

 

Session 2: Road Map for SAP Cloud ALM 

Session ID: CS805 
When: Tuesday, Nov. 4, 11:45am 

In this deep-dive session, we‚Äôll walk through the latest innovations and upcoming features of SAP Cloud ALM. Expect insights on autonomous capabilities, integrated tool chains, and the role of the Joule copilot in simplifying daily operations. 

We‚Äôll also discuss the SAP Readiness Check for SAP Cloud ALM, designed to help customers plan and execute their transition from SAP Solution Manager with confidence. Whether you‚Äôre just getting started with Cloud ALM or looking to optimize existing operations, this session will provide practical guidance for your next steps. 

 

 

Why You Should Attend 

Both sessions are designed to help you understand what‚Äôs next for SAP Cloud ALM, but how you can get there. Join me in Berlin to explore how SAP Cloud ALM is evolving into a transformation execution platform powered by broad integrations and meaningful AI - and how your organization can benefit from it today. 

 

Now let‚Äôs hear from you: 

What are your most favorite features in SAP Cloud ALM? Let me know in the comments! 

 

#SAP #ALM #CloudALM #Strategy #Roadmap #AI #AutonomousAI

entry.title: Everything You Need to Know About SAP Discovery Center Before TechEd
entry.content:
SAP TechEd 2025 is approaching‚Äîthe premier annual event for SAP developers, solution architects, and IT professionals worldwide. With thousands of sessions, hands-on workshops, and networking opportunities waiting for you, success at TechEd depends on how well-prepared you arrive. That's where the SAP Discovery Center's latest updates come in. 

From a comprehensive SAP AI Return-On-Investment (ROI) calculator that provides real-time financial justification for AI packages to an enhanced SAP BTP Guidance Framework that serves as your star map to best practices, these updates, these updates directly address the challenges you face every day: proving value, reducing implementation risk, and accelerating digital transformation timelines.

Whether you're a solution architect planning your next SAP Business Technology Platform implementation, a developer exploring AI possibilities, or an IT leader who needs to justify technology investments with hard numbers, the new SAP Discovery Center features will become your most valuable pre-TechEd preparation. Let's dive into what's new, why it matters, and how you can leverage these tools to maximize your TechEd experience and drive immediate value back to your organization.

AI on SAP Discovery Center

1. Enhanced AI Catalogue: Your Complete AI Solution Navigator

The SAP Business AI Catalogue has received a major upgrade that transforms how you explore and evaluate AI solutions. The catalogue now features dedicated categories for "Joule" and "AI Agent", making it easier than ever to find the specific AI capabilities you need for your organization.

Major Enhancements:

  • The catalogue now reflects SAP's new per-user-per-month commercial model, providing transparent pricing visibility
  • AI packages that bundle AI agents and features alongside consumption-based AI agents and features for flexible implementation options
  • Comma-separated value (CSV) export functionality allows you to download the entire AI catalogue for offline analysis, team sharing, and integration with your procurement processes

üîóExplore the enhanced AI Catalogue: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/ai-catalog/

 

2. Streamlined Discovery with Intelligent Filtering

The completely redesigned filters improve the experience of searching through SAP Discovery Center‚Äôs AI offerings. The updated interface and enhanced look-and-feel make finding relevant offerings faster and more efficient.

Key Improvements:

  • Smart filters help you pinpoint AI offerings that match your specific use cases, industry, and technical requirements
  • At-a-glance information on catalogue cards provides essential details without requiring deep navigation
  • Improved user experience that reduces time-to-insight and accelerates your AI exploration journey

 

3. ROI-Driven Decision Making with the AI Estimator

The new Return-on-Investment (ROI) calculation feature added to the AI Estimator transforms how organizations evaluate and justify AI investments. With the ROI estimation, users can make more informed decisions on AI packages and consumption-based AI offerings.

Game-Changing Capabilities:

  • Real-time ROI calculations for both AI packages and consumption-based AI offerings
  • Transparent methodology that explains how ROI estimates are calculated, building confidence in your investment decisions
  • Business case support that provides the financial justification needed for executive approval and budget allocation

üîóCalculate your AI ROI: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/ai-estimator-v1

 

4. Integrated AI and SAP BTP Service Connections

The enhanced SAP BTP Service Catalogue with clear linkage between AI offerings and SAP BTP services now shows exactly which AI offerings relate to specific services, providing comprehensive visibility into how AI capabilities can amplify your existing SAP BTP investments.

Revolutionary Features:

  • Direct AI offering visibility within SAP BTP service detail pages eliminates the guesswork in finding relevant AI capabilities
  • Improved use case planning and implementation by understanding how AI can enhance your existing SAP BTP services, and with clear connections between the AI foundation and AI capabilities

üîóExplore integrated AI offerings: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/serviceCatalog/sap-build-process-automation?region=all&tab=relatedaiofferings

Other Updates on SAP Discovery Center

1. SAP BTP Guidance Framework: Your Star Map for Guidance Assets

The new SAP BTP Guidance Framework is a resource that extends the scope for architects by providing comprehensive methodologies and guidance. This framework serves as your guide toward architecting, developing, and deploying enterprise-grade solutions on SAP BTP.

What Makes This Framework Essential:

  • Structured adoption phases provide clear direction and a proven approach for adopting SAP BTP according to industry best practices
  • Tailored recommendations drive your organization's SAP BTP maturity through an integrated maturity assessment
  • Strategic decision support helps you make the right decisions at the right time, maximizing value from your SAP BTP investments
  • Comprehensive guidance covers everything from initial planning to advanced enterprise implementations

This framework is particularly valuable for SAP TechEd attendees who want to move beyond tactical implementations to strategic, enterprise-scale SAP BTP adoption.

üîóAccess the BTP Guidance Framework: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/guidance-framework

 

2.  Events: Expanding the SAP Discovery Center Knowledge Universe

The SAP Discovery Center homepage now features a dedicated Events section. This new section serves as a centralized resource for hands-on events designed for both SAP customers and partners, adding another dimension to the Discovery Center's comprehensive learning ecosystem.

Partner and Customer Benefits:

  • Hands-on learning opportunities help customers and partners deepen their knowledge and enhance their technical skills
  • Knowledge transfer that benefits the entire ecosystem by making expertise more accessible to all audiences
  • Networking opportunities connect partners with SAP experts and fellow practitioners
  • Customer value enhancement through access to more knowledgeable, qualified partners
  • Ecosystem strengthening by making partner enablement more visible and accessible
  • Accelerated adoption through joint events that align partner capabilities with customer needs and use cases

üîóDiscover events: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/index.html#

 

3.  Latest Mission Releases: Learning That Drives Results

The SAP Discovery Center continues to expand its use case portfolio with six new missions that address the most pressing enterprise challenges:

üöÄActivate Joule with SAP Integrated Business Planning (IBP)
üöÄSetup of Joule in Mobile Start
üöÄAccelerate Smart Supplier Selection with Retrieval-Augmented Generative AI
üöÄMigrate data from SAP Business One to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
üöÄAccelerate your BTP Journey with FRE Acceleration Datasphere Pack
üöÄExtend SAP SuccessFactors HCM Solutions with Mobile App

These hands-on experiences provide practical, implementable knowledge that bridges the gap between theoretical understanding and real-world application, ensuring both partners and customers can immediately leverage cutting-edge SAP technologies.

How Missions Guide Your Journey: 

  • Hands-on learning experiences that provide practical skills through guided, interactive tutorials and real-world scenarios
  • Self-paced exploration allows partners and customers to learn at their own speed and revisit content as needed
  • Comprehensive skill development covering beginner to advanced topics across SAP's entire technology portfolio
  • Immediate practical application with step-by-step guidance that can be implemented directly in production environments  
  • Reduced learning curve for new SAP technologies through expert-designed tutorials and best practices

üîó Explore all new missions: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/missioncatalog

 

SAP Business Technology Platform ‚Äì Priority Use Cases

Explore the comprehensive range of SAP Business Technology Platform use cases that these missions support here:

üîóhttps://www.sap.com/products/technology-platform/use-cases.html?sort=latest_desc

 

Your Next Steps

As you prepare for SAP TechEd 2025, think of these tools as your spacecraft's vital systems: the ROI Calculator as your fuel efficiency monitor, ensuring every investment delivers maximum propulsion; the SAP BTP Guidance Framework as your star maps, guiding you safely through complex architectural decisions; and the Events as your communication array, keeping you connected with the broader SAP ecosystem of knowledge and expertise.

The countdown to SAP TechEd has begun. Your mission parameters are set. These SAP Discovery Center updates aren't just features‚Äîthey're your launch sequence for achieving breakthrough results. Whether you're embarking on your first SAP BTP expedition or you're a seasoned space traveller ready for advanced AI exploration, you now have everything needed for a successful mission.

 

Ready for liftoff to transform your SAP journey?

  • Register now and start building your agenda
  • Connect with us on social media for real-time updates
  • Join the conversation using #SAPTechEd2025

In the next blog, we will discuss our recommended sessions for your SAP TechEd agenda in more detail.

Don't just attend SAP TechEd 2025‚Äîmake it the catalyst for your next breakthrough.

entry.title: SAP TechEd Virtual Business Data Cloud Session Recommendations
entry.content:
Every data team has that moment when the project road map looks clear‚Äîuntil the next critical business need arises. A new AI use case demands sub-second inference. A migration uncovers decades of business warehouse logic you can‚Äôt break. Forecasts need to turn into orders faster than the business can email another spreadsheet. When the stakes are this high, you don‚Äôt need more noise; you need the right signals to move from idea to impact. 

SAP TechEd Virtual is where you compress months of exploration into days of focused learning, with a front‚Äërow seat to how SAP‚Äôs data and AI stack is evolving. Picture your team collaborating: your data engineer lines up an AI‚Äëready backbone, your data scientist charts a governed path from historical data to models, and your business analyst turns insights into coordinated action. To help you build that kind of high-impact agenda, here are a few sessions to look out for by role‚Äîeach chosen to solve real problems you‚Äôre likely tackling or will tackle in the near future. 

For Data Engineers: 

  • SAP Business Data Cloud: Strategy, architecture, and vision (ST107v) 
    The SAP Business Data Cloud solution is a pivotal component of SAP's strategic initiatives. This solution facilitates the development and governance of data products, providing a robust foundation for analytics, artificial intelligence, and intelligent applications. It leverages contextual data and semantics to enhance the capabilities of these technologies. In this session, you will gain a better understanding of the architectural direction and data management priorities, ensuring a comprehensive approach to data management. 
  • SAP Business Data Cloud: The path forward for SAP Business Warehouse (DA203v) 
    Examine best practices for modernizing your SAP Business Warehouse (SAP BW) application utilizing the SAP Business Data Cloud (SAP BDC) solution. Gain insights into minimizing migration risks, preserving existing objects within SAP BW, and delivering these objects as managed data products and intelligent applications while leveraging the most recent data and AI capabilities in SAP BDC. 
  • What‚Äôs next for SAP HANA Cloud: Road map and innovation highlights (DA817v) 
    Gain insights into the future of SAP HANA Cloud in 2025 and beyond. Discover upcoming innovations for AI-driven application development, including the generative AI toolkit, tabular AI functions, and capabilities designed to facilitate data connectivity with AI agents. 
  • Accelerating your AI strategy with SAP HANA Cloud (DA201v) 
    Examine the embedded artificial intelligence capabilities of SAP HANA Cloud, which drive intelligent applications. Gain insights into the functionality of tabular AI, the SAP HANA Cloud vector engine, and the SAP HANA Cloud knowledge graph engine, which collectively support generative AI scenarios. These capabilities enable the development of context-rich, AI-driven applications on SAP Business Technology Platform. 

For Data Scientists: 

  • SAP HANA Cloud: The database for business AI (ST115v) 
    As the database foundation for SAP Business Technology Platform and the SAP Business Data Cloud solution, SAP HANA Cloud is pivotal to SAP's AI vision. Explore how SAP HANA Cloud facilitates advanced analytics, multi-model processing, and intelligent applications, particularly in the realms of machine learning and generative AI. Additionally, delve into the strategic roadmap for its future development. 
  • Build custom AI solutions with the generative AI hub (AI100v) 
    Gain expertise in developing AI applications tailored to your business needs by utilizing the generative AI hub functionality within AI Foundation. Explore the capabilities of crafting prompts and employing grounding, orchestration, and SDKs to create and deploy scalable, fact-based AI applications across various domains, including chat applications and retrieval augmented generation (RAG) systems. 
  • Power up and accelerate your business with SAP‚Äôs AI operating system (ST120v) 
    Prompt engineering has become a relic of the past. Embark on a journey into the future of SAP's AI operating system, your cornerstone for constructing, expanding, and executing AI at an unprecedented scale. Unveil the next frontier in LLM integration, automatic prompt optimization, grounding, and orchestration. Gain insights into how SAP's AI operating system propels secure and transformative AI outcomes. 
  • Building custom AI agents and skills with Joule Studio (AI105v) 
    Discover Joule Studio and the intricacies of extending Joule technology through custom skills and the creation of AI agents. Gain insights into the process of developing, deploying, and managing agents that align seamlessly with your business objectives. Benefit from live demonstrations and a comprehensive walkthrough of pivotal capabilities, catering specifically to developers and IT professionals. 
  • Empower your agents to be responsible (IN200v) 
    Gain an introduction to the evolving standards and protocols governing the interaction of AI agents with the APIs of applications, tools, resources, and large language models. Comprehend the pivotal role of the API Management capability within SAP Integration Suite in facilitating, regulating, and safeguarding these critical agentic integrations. 

For Business Analysts: 

  • SAP Business Data Cloud solution road map (DA806v) 
    Gain insights into the product roadmap for SAP Business Data Cloud and the ongoing development in key areas, such as data center availability, expanded support for data products and intelligent applications, new connectivity options, and other core enhancements. Discover SAP‚Äôs plans to continue delivering innovation to support your data strategy. 
  • Planning and analytics: Innovations powering SAP Business Data Cloud (DA207v) 
    Gain insights into how SAP Business Data Cloud facilitates unified, real-time planning and analytics, empowering businesses to collaborate, adapt, and achieve strategic objectives. Through illustrative examples and live demonstrations, explore how organizations modernize their planning processes, integrate AI insights, and unlock the comprehensive value of enterprise data. 
  • Transforming how people work with Joule technology (ST123v) 
    Gain insights into upcoming innovations, third-party integrations, and customization options from Joule that enable you to interact in innovative ways and access the information you require across your applications. Hear the latest announcements regarding Joule, uncover the driving forces behind its development, and understand how it is propelling the delivery of a groundbreaking user interface for the era of agentic AI.

You won‚Äôt want to miss these impactful sessions that will help you and your business simplify processes, deliver insights in fewer clicks, and create intuitive, human-centered experiences across applications. This virtual conference gives you a front-row view of what‚Äôs ahead in AI-driven application development, from generative tooling and tabular functions to data-to-agent capabilities that connect intelligence directly to your workflows.  

Browse the Virtual TechEd page and sign up today to secure your spot, then build your personalized schedule to lock in the sessions that matter most.

In CS100, we‚Äôll explore the strategic and technical journey from SAP Solution Manager to SAP Cloud ALM. You‚Äôll gain insights from a real customer use case and see key tools like SAP Activate, SAP Readiness Check, and selective data transfer in action during a live demo. In CS160, you‚Äôll get hands-on experience using SAP-provided tools and environments to explore how to move selected content and understand the transition approach.   • BlueSky: https://bsky.app/profile/innersource.bsky.social/post/3m2rzrmmspk2j 
  • X/Twitter: https://x.com/sapopensource/status/1976679116695888151 

BTP Trial Update: CF Runtime Availability 

  • Blog post https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/btp-trial-update-cf-runtime-availability/ba-p/14247240 

SAP Business Data Cloud deep-dives 

  • SAP Business Data Cloud ‚Äì An Architecture Deep Dive: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest/sap-business-data-cloud-an-architecture-deep-dive/ev-p/14214642 
  • Provisioning SAP Business Data Cloud Connect: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/provisioning-sap-business-data-cloud-connect-and-enrolling-with-existing/ba-p/14237512  
  • People Intelligence in SAP Business Data Cloud is Generally Available: https://community.sap.com/t5/delivery-blog-posts/people-intelligence-in-sap-business-data-cloud-is-generally-available/ba-p/14240825  
  • Data and Analytics (DA) at SAP TechEd: https://www.sap.com/events/teched/berlin/flow/sap/te25/tracks-inperson/page/data-and-analytics   

Developing Mobile Apps with AI Agents: Introducing the MCP Server for MDK 

  • https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/developing-mobile-apps-with-ai-agents-introducing-the-mcp-server-for-mobile/ba-p/14237709 
  • https://github.com/SAP/mdk-mcp-server 

SAP TechEd 2025 

  • Event Site: https://www.sap.com/events/teched.html 

 

CHAPTER TITLES  

0:00 Intro 

0:10 Innersource Summit 2025 

1:09 BTP Trial Update: CF Runtime Availability 

2:00 SAP Business Data Cloud deep-dives 

3:10 Developing Mobile Apps with AI Agents: Introducing the MCP Server for MDK 

4:08 SAP TechEd 

 

TRANSCRIPTION

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for October 23rd, 2025.

[Ajay] Everyone. Have you ever heard about Innersource? It is the practice of applying open source methodologies, culture, and best practices to the in-house software development. SAP is co-hosting and co-organizing the Innersource Summit in Berlin this year. If you want to know more about it, it is a great opportunity for you. The InnerSource Summit 2025 will take place on November 13th, 2025 across Berlin, Yokohama, and New York. It is hosted by SAP, Mitsubishi Electric, and IBM. The agenda is filled with topics about open-source-inspired collaborations, InnerSource analytics, state of InnerSource in the industry, measuring cross-team collaboration, scientific research about InnerSource, and much more. Join the event in person on-site or virtually online. Check the blog post by Gillyherme to find the agenda and how to get the tickets. Links will be available in the description below.

[DJ] Here is an important item for users of the SAP BTP trial account landscape. It concerns the Cloud Foundry runtime specifically. Owing to a high amount of misuse of this part of the platform, the offering for the Cloud Foundry runtime will be drastically restricted for the time being. The main difference for us is that for this period we won't be able to deploy to a CF runtime. Remember, this is regarding the trial landscape only. We strongly advise you to check out Karen Burke's blog post and stay tuned to that for updates. You can also, of course, ask questions there as comments on that blog post if you need to. Link to the blog post is in the description.

[Witalij] As the Devtoberfest first concludes, we hope you joined the sessions on SAP Business Data Cloud, including the architectural deep dive led by the product CTO. While Bjorn delivered a comprehensive overview, the 30-minute format limited the depth of the coverage for key topics such as data products, BW and BDC, or SAP Databricks, but each of which was explored in dedicated sessions earlier this month. Refer to the dedicated blog post for additional insights on Business Data Cloud Connect. BDC Connect is a newly launched service designed to facilitate secure, bi-directional, and zero-copy data product sharing between SAP BDC and external partner systems. Early adopters include Databricks and Google Cloud. Nedel Eduardo provides a detailed walkthrough in a separate post for technical specifics on provisioning BDC Connect. We look forward to seeing you at SAP TechEd on tour and virtually in November, where hands-on workshops will offer practical experience with these advancements. Stay tuned for more.

[Kevin] Hey everybody, if you are a mobile developer, kit developer building cross-platform applications for mobile devices, I got good news for you. The team just released the MDK MCP server on GitHub. It's open source and you can easily install it via NPM on your local machine. You can use the MCP server from out of Klein or GitHub Copilot to not only bootstrap new MDK applications but also enhance your existing ones with new features. It has a port for access to the MDK CLI tools. So you have the whole tool set at your fingertips to build great mobile applications. If you want to find out more, there is a blog post in the community explaining all the details and linking to all the additional resources for you. As always, you can find the link to the blog post in the description of our news video.

[Tom] As this episode of the developer news reaches you, we're nearing the end of Devtoberfest. It's been a great four weeks and I hope that you've enjoyed the time and learned a lot. But you know what the end of Devtoberfest means ‚Äî the start of SAP TechEd. Whether you plan to join us in person in Berlin, on the virtual platform, or at one of the many TechEd on tour stops around the world, we look forward to bringing you TechEd. Our team at the Developer Advocates is busy getting ready for the developer garage, hands-on workshops, community talks, as well as, of course, the developer keynote. We can't wait to show you all the great new things that are planned for this year, and we look forward to seeing you at TechEd.

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025 | Real-time data for AI agents: Grounding with event-driven architecture
entry.content:
A couple of words about me: 

My name is Sunny Kapoor and I am a lead product manager for the cloud integration capability of SAP Integration Suite, specializing in enterprise-wide business process integration and digital transformation. With 15 years of professional experience, I offer a comprehensive understanding of both technical implementation and strategic product oversight.

My Session: 

IN162 | Real-time data for AI agents: Grounding with event-driven architecture | Tuesday, Nov 4 | 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM CET

What you will learn about: 

This session introduces attendees to the power of event-driven integration pattern to deliver real-time grounding data, equipping AI system's with the latest business context to make informed and accurate decisions.

AI Grounding is the process of connecting an AI system's abstract knowledge and responses to specific, real-world data and context, reducing "hallucinations" and increasing the reliability and accuracy of its outputs.

 
This session focuses into the advanced realm of real-time vector grounding, where you'll connect structured enterprise data to a large language model using SAP HANA Cloud‚Äôs vector database, SAP Integration Suite, and Advanced Event Mesh. Experience firsthand how dynamic data updates can enhance the model's responses in real time, maintaining their contextual precision. By session's end, you'll have constructed an end-to-end, event-driven flow that responds to new sales order events from SAP S/4HANA Cloud and support case events from SAP Service Cloud Version 2, providing an AI assistant with live contextual intelligence. This hands-on scenario simulates an AI-powered Customer Success Digital Assistant, equipping it with real-time sales and support data to deliver accurate insights and informed decision-making capabilities.

Co-speakers:

Prashant Gautam, Senior Product Manager, has been with SAP since 2004. With strong focus on innovation, he works on advancing Artificial Intelligence capabilities in SAP Integration Suite, driving efficiency and modernisation in integration space.

 

Karsten Strothmann is lead product manager and evangelist for event-driven integration at SAP SE in Walldorf, Germany. With over 25 years of experience in the software industry, he has extensively focused on Event-Driven Architecture (EDA) and its implementation at the enterprise level.

 

Piyush Gakhar heads the cross product management & strategy for Integration solutions such as SAP Integration Suite, API Management, Event Mesh & SAP Process Orchestration.

 

 

Take a look at our overall SAP Integration Suite sessions üëá 

https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-teched-blog-posts/shape-what-s-next-with-sap-integration-suite-at-teched-2025/ba-p/14220264 

Other related sessions I recommend:  

You can also gain some further knowledge around SAP Integration Suite and SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh by attending the following SAP TechEd sessions:

  • IN103 | Helping systems talk smarter with a flexible event-driven architecture
    • Deep Dive
    • When: Wednesday, Nov 5 | 2:15 PM - 3:00 PM CET
  • IN165 | Experience event-driven integration with advanced event mesh
    • Hands-on Workshop
    • When: Thursday, Nov 6 | 11:30 AM - 1:30 PM CET
  • IN160 | Empower your business through enterprise automation
    • Hands-on Workshop
    • When: Wednesday, Nov 5 | 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM CET
  • IN163 | Implement exactly once in-order delivery in SAP Integration Suite
    • Hands-on Workshop
    • When: Wednesday, Nov 5 | 3:30 PM - 5:30 PM CET

Related community topic pages: 

  •  SAP Integration Suite
  • Joule 

Looking forward to seeing you: 

Join to learn how event-driven integration patterns can keep AI systems contextually aware and up-to-date with the latest business information.

Now let‚Äôs hear from you:

We‚Äôd love to hear your thoughts on the concept of real-time data grounding using evet-driven architecture. Share your insights and ideas by answering these questions in the comments below:

  • In what ways do you think real-time vector grounding can enhance the capabilities of AI Agents.
  • How do you plan to apply the skills and knowledge gained from this workshop to your ongoing or future projects?

Let's start a conversation and learn from each other's perspectives! 

Don't forget to register for the workshop to secure your spot and join us for this hands-on learning experience!

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025 Speakers' Series: Special SAP Community Moments
entry.content:
Hello everyone!

My name is Moshe Naveh from the SAP community team. It‚Äôs this time of the year when SAP community members come together. Those attending SAP TechEd in person and virtually add another dimension to their online community friendships and bonding. I feel it‚Äôs like our virtual family reunion and everyone share where they are at in their life and SAP Community journey.

Therefore, in this blog post I will share about my own community journey that started back in 2009 and still happily continues these days:

  1. My Special SAP Community moments and initiatives
  2. SAP Community members' SAP TechEd sessions
  3. Share your SAP Community special moments, first and recent post and cool picture

Why I wear these ears:) :

My special ears on to show tribute to the Blog It Forward series during SAP TechEd Berlin 2014

 

 My Special SAP Community Moments

1) Community challenges/initiatives 

The community challenges are a great opportunity to get to know other SAP Community members. What they are passionate about, the amazing people they are, places they have been to and more.

Here are some challenges/initiative I ran since I joined the community and gave me great joy:

Blog forward, What do you do?, SAP Sapphire speaker series and the most recent one, our hobbies series. It is so much fun getting to know how creative, diligent, sportive our SAP Community members are:

Featuring of the Hobbies series

  2) My first SAP Inside Track

Back in 2013 I organized the first SAP Inside Track in Israel. We had over than 100 SAP Community members from 40 different companies. The event included 23 sessions, each lasting 15 minutes (which was then innovative). 

Audience at SAP Inside Track 2013 Israel

Organizing the event was a complex project: 

  • Identifying the right speakers and working with them to optimize their presentations
  • Inviting and following up with the attendees 
  • Working on all the required logistics: Catering, venue, sound and IT systems and much more

It was so much fun and our dear community members had an amazing time.

3) SAP TechEd events

My first SAP TechEd was in SAP TechEd Bangalore- 2012. I had so much fun! It was my first time in India as well. I was amazed by so many things: the event itself and the innovative booths, the great Indian food, beautiful touristic attractions and above all I was so happy to meet the SAP community members from India and other locations. To suddenly talk, shake hands and even dance with my online friends was a great pleasure. We also had a gathering of the Blog it forward participants and we all celebrated together 10 years of SAP community. 

Jitendra Kansal and I, in SAP TechEd Bangalore 2012

The following SAP TechEd events I attended continued to be unforgettable experiences. Each SAP TechEd event offered it‚Äôs own unique spirit and cool SAP Community activities

I'm broadcasting from the SAP TechEd Berlin 2017

4) Simplified blogging

I‚Äôm very fortunate that after almost 16 years as an SAP Community advocate, I‚Äôm still passionate about what I do. One of things I most passionate is to support our dear SAP Community members to make the most out of their SAP Community experience. This is what led me to establish the simplified blogging methodology. 

The idea behind this method is that by using AI tools and predefined templates per event, SAP Community members can reduce the time it takes them to blog by up to 75%. The method was initially trialed at the SAP Sapphire speakers‚Äô series and received positive feedback from the authors/speakers. By keeping our AI guidelines and keep the content unique and with your own voice, you can dramatically reduce the time it takes you to blog. 

Simplified blogging methodology was used in smaller events but also in our current SAP Sapphire speakers series (and the recap series where the AI tools usage was introduced). The most recent usage of the simplified blogging methodology is the SAP TechEd Berlin speakers 2025 series which I would like to share with you today. 

Every session by an SAP Community member is a special SAP Community moment. It is where everyone can connect and share knowledge, which is also what our SAP Community is about. In this series our remarkable SAP Community members who speak at SAP TechEd Berlin 2025, shared what they are going to present about. They also invite you to engage and network with them before the event via multiple interesting questions:

 

Title

Author

Real-time data for AI agents: Grounding with event-driven architecture

@sunny_kapoor 

Discover SAP Cloud ALM for operations in action

@stephaniejerch 

Shaping the Future of SAP Cloud ALM:

@soeren_ruder 

From insight to action to agents: SAP Signavio roadmap session

@hoangvu 

AI agent hub: how to discover and control all your AI agents

@Michelle10 

Guidance to Ease Your Transition to SAP Cloud ERP Private

@matthiasstegmue 

Mastering zero trust: SAP Customer Identity and Access Management

@rakefetga20 

Analyze and optimize front-end application performance

@Joaquin_RecioHuertas 

SAP Business Data Cloud: Data products, master data, governance

@AndreasSeifried 

Production Readiness Isn't Optional: A Practical Look at XP265

@thorsten_sandfuchs 

Where‚Äôs Waldo ‚Ä¶ ah ‚Ä¶ Terraform?

@lechnerc77 

Enabling clean core development with SAP HANA Cloud and SAP Build Code

@shraddhashetty 

SAP HANA Cloud - Advisors and automation

@jinheejeong 

 Transitioning from SAP Solution Manager to SAP Cloud ALM

@a_schulze 

 

 

Recently @AnnePetteroe  introduced guidelines for content created with generative AI. They enable even more straight forward and optimal method and guidelines for when using AI tools to create content in the SAP Community.

Like always, SAP TechEd is going to be filled with lots of great SAP activities and opportunities! Read more about it in @josh_bentley  blog post.

I really look forward to meeting many great SAP community friends and making new onesüôÇ. Come and visit us in the SAP community booth! Come and take a profile picture, chat, ask questions, share ideas and whatever you feel likeüôÇ.

Now, before ending this post, I would like to invite you to share in the comments (you can answer one or more questions):

  • When did you join the SAP community?
  • What is your first/most special memory of the community?
  • Link to your first and most recent posts

 If you have a picture or a video to add as well as tag others, that would be amazing!

Looking forward to reading all about your special SAP Community moments!

entry.title: SAP TechEd 2025: Your Must-Attend Sessions on SAP BTP
entry.content:
It feels like I came back from SAP Connect just yesterday, but SAP TechEd is now less than two weeks away. In addition to the virtual event, SAP TechEd 2025 will be held in five different cities and offer hundreds of sessions. Here‚Äôs my guide to the must-attend sessions for AI agents, SAP Business Technology Platform architecture, Extensions, and Integration across the world, as well as Virtual.

 

Why SAP TechEd 2025 is Unmissable

The enterprise technology landscape is evolving at breakneck speed, and SAP TechEd 2025 promises to be the defining moment where cutting-edge innovation meets hands-on expertise. This is the leading event for developers and IT professionals ready to explore SAP's most transformative technologies and emerge with skills that deliver measurable impact from day one.

SAP TechEd

  • SAP TechEd Berlin (November 4-6, 2025) offers the flagship in-person experience where you'll connect directly with SAP experts, participate in hands-on workshops, and build lasting professional relationships within the global SAP community
  • SAP TechEd Virtual (November 4-6, 2025) provides the same high-quality technical content online for free for maximum accessibility, allowing you to explore the latest innovations in application development, integration, data, and AI from anywhere in the world

SAP TechEd on Tour

The SAP TechEd on Tour series delivers localized, immersive experiences tailored to regional technical communities. Each event combines the core SAP TechEd experience with region-specific insights, local expert networks, and formats optimized for different technical communities and career advancement goals.

  • ASUG Tech Connect in Louisville, KY (November 4-6) focuses on practical skills for North American practitioners
  • Mastering SAP in Sydney, Australia (November 12-14) brings together Asia-Pacific technical experts for intensive learning and networking
  • SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore, India (November 25-26) offers hands-on workshops and certification boot camps designed for the thriving Indian developer community
  • DSAG TechXchange 2026 in Hamburg, Germany (March 19) provides specialized DevOps-focused sessions for European technical professionals

 

Must-Attend Sessions at SAP TechEd 2025

Don't miss these carefully curated sessions that will give you the deepest insights into SAP's technology roadmap and hands-on skills you can immediately apply. Here are my top recommendations for SAP TechEd Berlin, Virtual, and ASUG Tech Connect, organized by city and focus area:

  • Extend Joule with Custom Skills and Custom Agents for SAP Cloud ERP: Get maximum value from the Joule copilot in SAP Cloud ERP by extending it with custom-built skills and intelligent agents that can plan, act, and execute tasks. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW       

  • Discovery Workshop: Start Your AI Agent Journey by Exploring AI Agent Use Cases: Explore how AI Agent capabilities can address your specific business challenges and learn the next steps for designing and building an AI Agent using the SAP Agent Builder. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW          

 üíª Application Development & Automation

  • SAP Build: Latest Innovations and Road Map: Explore the strategic road map for the SAP Build portfolio and see how recent and upcoming innovations in low-code and pro-code tools are transforming application development, process automation, and business site design. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

  • Introduction to Application Development and Automation: Learn how the key capabilities, recent innovations, and road map for SAP‚Äôs application development and automation solutions enable you to build, extend, and automate apps quickly. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

 üîó Integration

  • Introduction to Integration: Harness AI to Future-Proof Your Integration Investment: Essential for anyone migrating from SAP PI/PO to SAP Integration Suite. Covers tools, best practices, and technical challenges with real-world insights. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

  • ASUG Community Conversations- SAP Integration in SAP Business Technology Platform: Connect with SAP experts and the ASUG Community as they share their experiences, solutions, and strategies. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

  • Innovations, Investments, and Future Road Map for SAP Integration Suite: Explore recent innovations across API management, event-driven architecture, B2B integration, hybrid deployment models, and AI-driven automation. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

 üîí Security & Compliance

  • Explore Security Services with SAP BTP: Explore the extensive capabilities of SAP BTP in security, identity, and access management. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

 

Register. Attend. Reap Results.

The sessions above represent hours of curated content distilled into the most impactful learning opportunities to deliver technical knowledge at SAP TechEd 2025. You'll get architecture frameworks, implementation strategies, and direct access to the platform's subject matter experts. Whether you're migrating integrations, deploying AI agents, or hardening security, these sessions answer your actual questions. And of course, you can't miss the keynotes at SAP TechEd to explore how SAP's newest technologies and capabilities will bring in results:

SAP TechEd - Berlin & Virtual

    üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì BERLIN | üóìÔ∏èADD NOW ‚Äì VIRTUAL

  • KEY103 | SAP TechEd closing: Wrap up SAP TechEd with highlights, key takeaways, and a look at what‚Äôs ahead. From breakthrough demos to developer wins, celebrate what you‚Äôve learned, where you‚Äôve connected, and how you can keep the momentum going long after SAP TechEd is over.

  • Shaping What‚Äôs Next: Insights from SAP, Databricks, and Customers: Join ASUG CEO Geoff Scott as he sits down with leaders from SAP, Databricks, and SAP customers to unpack the big themes driving transformation, from cloud and AI to business change and innovation. üóìÔ∏èREAD NOW

Register now, add these sessions to your agenda, and come with your toughest problems.

entry.title: SAP TechEd Sessions in Berlin and Sydney 2025 by KP Sauer
entry.content:
SAP TechEd 2025

One more week to #SAPTechEd 2025.
I am super excited ‚ú® to speak at this year‚Äôs SAP TechEd in Berlin, and also in Sydney for SAP TechEd on Tour.

ü§© Looking forward to meet and talk to all you data and analytics experts in Berlin or Sydney.

Join me for a variety of sessions this year and gain a comprehensive understanding of our strategic direction and priorities with SAP Business Data Cloud.

 

SAP TechEd in Berlin

Deep Dive Sessions

‚û°Ô∏è  DA204 | The impact of SAP Business Data Cloud on SAP Datasphere users

This session is for all users of SAP Datasphere to better understand the impact with SAP Business Data Cloud and the new options you get within such a new landscape. Rithivika Acharya will give you a demo and we will have some time for Q&A at the end

üîó  https://www.sap.com/events/teched/berlin/flow/sap/te25/catalog-inperson/page/catalog/session/1753913915410001RQyH

 

‚û°Ô∏è  DA203 | SAP Business Data Cloud: The path forward for SAP Business Warehouse

This session is for all users of SAP BW or BW/4HANA to better understand the impact with SAP Business Data Cloud and exploring the best practices for modernizing with such a new landscape. Domink Kurz will mainly talk here and we will have some time for Q&A at the end.

üîó  https://www.sap.com/events/teched/berlin/flow/sap/te25/catalog-inperson/page/catalog/session/1753910209205001V1Vm

 

Hands-on Workshop

‚û°Ô∏è  DA264 | SAP Business Data Cloud: Explore the analytical components end to end

This beginner hands-on workshop takes you through the analytical components of the SAP Business Data Cloud solution. Use the SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud solutions to design and build custom scenarios from beginning to end. This session is ideal for technical users seeking to transform data into meaningful business insights. I will be hosting this together with Hannes Keil, Daniel Ingenhaag and Florian Neukirch.

üîó  https://www.sap.com/events/teched/berlin/flow/sap/te25/catalog-inperson/page/catalog/session/1754056240863001fO9w

 

Are you ready? üëâ Register now: https://www.sap.com/events/teched.html

 

SAP TechEd on Tour in Sydney

In Sydney I will be talking live about üöÄ

‚û°Ô∏è  DA806 | SAP Business Data Cloud Solution Road Map

Join me and gain a comprehensive understanding of our strategic direction and priorities with SAP Business Data Cloud. Find out about the product road map and ongoing development in key areas. Learn about our plans to continue to deliver innovation to aid in your data strategy.

 

‚û°Ô∏è  DA100 | An Introduction to SAP Business Data Cloud

Join us for an insightful overview of SAP Business Data Cloud. Discover the key capabilities including seamless integration of SAP and non-SAP data sources, the data product concept, and analytics-ready data across your organization. Learn how SAP Business Data Cloud supports agile decision-making, simplifies complex data challenges, and drives digital transformation.

 

Other than these sessions I will be around the show floor and support hands-on sessions too.
So please be welcome to talk to me as I‚Äôm happy to share my SAP experience during the three days üì¢

Passes to Mastering SAP Collaborate, an SAP TechEd on Tour event, are available online now ‚Äì join me in Sydney on 12 ‚Äì 14 November!

Program and passes at http://sapteched.sydney and best of all you can use code SPEAKER5OFF to save 5% on a pass.

üóì  When: 12 - 14 November 2025

üìç  Where: International Convention Centre, ICC, Darling Harbour, Sydney

 

Related community topic pages:

SAP Business Data Cloud | SAP Community

SAP Datasphere | SAP Community

SAP Analytics Cloud | SAP Community

 

Looking forward to seeing you in Berlin and Sydney!

 

Now let‚Äôs hear from you

  • What is your favorite feature in SAP Datasphere?
  • Do you already have any plans for SAP Business Data Cloud or are you waiting to adopt?

 Please add your thoughts as comments to this blog. Thanks!

entry.title: Join the Community Talks at SAP TechEd Berlin 2025 in the Community Theatre!
entry.content:
SAP TechEd Berlin 2025 is just around the corner ‚Äî and this year‚Äôs program is packed with opportunities to learn, connect, and grow alongside fellow SAP community members.

Among the many highlights on the agenda, one area you won‚Äôt want to miss is the Community Theatre‚Äî a space where the SAP community itself takes the stage to share real experiences, creative ideas, and practical insights through Community Talks.

‚ÄÉ

What Are SAP Community Talks?

Community Talks are short, 20-minute sessions designed for open knowledge sharing. Presented by community members, SAP experts, and partners, they bring real-world stories and lessons learned directly to the heart of SAP TechEd.

These talks complement the full TechEd experience ‚Äî from keynotes and deep dives to hands-on workshops ‚Äî by offering a more conversational, interactive format that celebrates collaboration and peer learning.

Each session offers something a little different: a success story, a trivia contest, a technical challenge overcome, a clever shortcut, or a spark of inspiration that others can build on.

Why You Should Attend

  • Learn from peers. Hear firsthand how others are using SAP technologies ‚Äî from SAP BTP and SAP Build to AI and data analytics ‚Äî to solve real-world problems.
  • Get inspired. Walk away with fresh ideas, lessons learned, and tangible takeaways you can apply immediately.
  • Connect with others. Meet passionate community members, developers, and advocates in an open, friendly space - in the SAP Community Clubhouse - where discussion is encouraged.

üëâRead: 9 things you need to know about SAP Community at SAP TechEd in Berlin

entry.title: CAP at SAP TechEd 2025
entry.content:
Dear SAP community,

SAP TechEd 2025 is almost there! This year, SAP TechEd is a hybrid event: from November 4 ‚Äì 6 you can either join the in-person event in Berlin or the online event SAP TechEd Virtual. Hundreds of sessions, hands-on workshops, and networking opportunities are waiting for you.

If you didn‚Äôt already do it, save the date and register today: SAP TechEd Berlin | SAP TechEd Virtual!

In the session catalogs for the in-person and the virtual event, you will find a wide range of topics across various tracks. If you are interested in all the latest news around the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP), let me guide you through my recommendations.

Keynote

KEY100 | Beyond the hype: How SAP is supercharging developers for what's next

Some experts argue there‚Äôs a developer shortage. Others will say developers are no longer needed due to AI. Let‚Äôs get real: developers, architects, and technologists are here to stay, and their roles are more important than ever. Explore how the latest technology, tools, AI, agents, and learning from SAP can help you adapt these changing roles.

This session is also available virtually: KEY100v.

Strategy Talk

ST116 | SAP Build for all: A shift toward AI-assisted developer-centric tools

Explore the most recent innovations in SAP Build solutions that help developers to create extensions, applications, and automations. Learn how enhancements in the development environment, SAP Cloud Application Programming Model, and Joule copilot empower customers and partners to build extensions efficiently at scale.

This session is also available virtually: ST116v.

Roadmap Sessions

AD820 | Future of app dev in SAP Build: Simplifying Clean Core & LoB extensions‚Äã

Check out upcoming enhancements to SAP Build solutions involving SAP‚Äôs professional developer tools, the Joule copliot, SAP Cloud Application Programming Model, SAPUI5, and SAP Fiori apps. These updates boost developer productivity, support clean core, and improve extensibility for line-of-business (LoB) apps, advancing enterprise app development.

This session is also available virtually: AD820v.

Deep Dive Sessions

AD101 | Integration of SAP Business Data Cloud with CAP and SAP Build‚Äã

The SAP Business Data Cloud solution unifies SAP and third-party data, and SAP Build solutions let you discover and use data products in the service center and consume them in apps based on SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP). Get details on sharing data from these apps and using built-in tools for service-level integration.

AD203 | Fact checking UI Extensibility on top of CAP/RAP: What's in it for you?‚Äã

SAPUI5 flexibility lets you extend SAP Fiori apps in a clean core approach. Key users use drag-and-drop tools while developers add custom code with visual editors and the Joule copilot. See how SAP Cloud Application Programming Model and ABAP RESTful application programming model help extend data models and add custom logic in SAP Build solutions.

Hands-On Workshops:

AD160 | Get Hands-On with Joule: Boost Your SAP Build Development with AI‚Äã

The SAP Joule for Developers add-on brings AI capabilities directly into SAP Build solutions to support your development process. Get hands-on experience using AI-driven tools to boost your productivity in SAP Cloud Application Programming Model and UI development, with features designed to simplify your workflow and help you build faster and smarter.                                                                            

AD161 | Integration of SAP Business Data Cloud with CAP and SAP Build‚Äã

Get hands-on experience with the SAP Business Data Cloud and SAP Build solutions to find out how to discover and use data products in apps based on SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP). Practice sharing data from CAP apps and using built-in tools for service integration and SAP HANA‚Äìbased data federation.

AD260 | UI Extensibility on top of CAP/RAP: What's in it for you?‚Äã

SAPUI5 flexibility lets you extend SAP Fiori apps with a clean core approach. Key users and developers can add custom code with visual editors and Joule technology. See how SAP Cloud Application Programming Model and the ABAP RESTful application programming model support extending data models and adding custom logic in the SAP Build solution.

DT265 | Provision and extend multitenant solutions based on CAP for SAP Cloud ERP‚Äã

Experience how to provision, configure, and extend multitenant solutions based on SAP Business Technology Platform and the SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) for SAP Cloud ERP. Using a reference example, you‚Äôll explore how to deliver customer-specific extensions on a scalable and resource-efficient multitenant architecture.

 

We can‚Äôt wait to see you at SAP TechEd 2025, either in Berlin or virtually!

entry.title: SAP Developer News October 30th, 2025
entry.content:
DESCRIPTION 

PODCAST: https://podcast.opensap.info/sap-developers/2025/10/30/sap-developer-news-october-30th-2025/ 

 

Devtoberfest Digest 

  • Devtoberfest Digest: https://url.sap/devtoberfest-digest 

 

Documentation collaboration and contributions 

  • Building Enterprise Grade CAP applications using BTP Developer's guide https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tUKMUIL9C6k  
  • Get to know more about CAP‚Äôs documentation offering https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gvjbxitDf18 
  • SAP BTP Developers Guide https://help.sap.com/docs/btp/btp-developers-guide/btp-developers-guide 
  • Open Documentation Initiative (podcast episode) https://podcast.opensap.info/open-source-way/2021/11/24/the-open-documentation-initiative-the-gold-standard-of-collaborative-documentation/  
  • Runtime Comparison Guide https://help.sap.com/docs/btp/comparison-btp-runtimes/runtime-comparison 

 

SAP TechEd 

  • Event Page: https://www.sap.com/events/teched.html 

 

SAP Community Voice 

  • October SAP Community Voice Post: https://community.sap.com/t5/what-s-new/sap-community-voice-get-ready-for-sap-teched-certifications-and-upcoming/ba-p/14255481 
  • Video Playlist: https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLpQebylHrdh5ZmJeJXl_pC9n7LcsfFjrZ&si=gr0wPQhCkXiWHhLC 

 

CHAPTER TITLES  

0:00 Intro 

0:10 Devtoberfest Digest 

2:13 Documentation collaboration and contributions 

4:03 SAP TechEd  

4:36 SAP Community Voice 

 

TRANSCRIPTION

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for October 30th, 2025.

[Antonio & Javier] Hola, SAP Developers. We just wrapped up Devtoberfest last week, but I know that many of you are still trying to catch up with all the great content that's part of Devtoberfest. Well, my friend Javier here developed a very nice tool called Devtoberfest Digest that can help you with this. Javier, can you share with us a bit about what Devtoberfest Digest is and what was your motivation to develop it? Hello, this is Javier Martin from the BTP solution advisory team in Spain. And well, the Devtoberfest Digest is an AI-powered solution that kind of watches all the sessions that you deliver on the event and magically extracts the relevant information from the different videos so you can get the key points and relevant data for your interests. Perfect. And what was your motivation to develop it? Well, my motivation, yeah, let's say that I heard that there was some new MCP servers that was already released, like the CAP and the Fiori MCP servers, so I wanted to test them out. And, well, I was kind of struggling with time, right, to follow all the great sessions, so just the idea came really quickly. Fantastic. And what are some of the technologies that power Devtoberfest Digest? So for the backend, I use CAP, a cloud application programming model. There is Fiori as well for the frontend, HANA Cloud for persistence. And I'm also using the orchestration service from the generative failure hub for LLM access. Nice. And where is it that everyone can access this tool? Yeah, so the tool is already developed on the BTP. We already created a short URL for you guys to consume it and well, I hope you find it useful. I'm sure I will find it useful because there are many sessions that I still need to catch up. Definitely. So thank you very much for sharing this with the community and I hope you all enjoy it. Thank you. Ciao.

[DJ] Here is a shout out to all you lovely content collaborators. During Devtoberfest, we had a couple of great sessions on documentation and documentation contributions. Ren√© and Mahadi gave us a great overview of the CAP documentation and explained the different ways you can get involved by sharing feedback or contributing content. Gopal talked about enterprise-grade capabilities for CAP apps with information based upon the SAP BTP Developers Guide, which is also open for collaboration as well. Don't forget that the Open Documentation Initiative is still very much alive and well, with plenty of documentation sets. In fact, there's been a recent edition of the Runtime Comparison Guide, and there are also still contribution badges to be earned, as well as just cool points from having your GitHub avatar listed in the repo. Alternatively, you can also just leave a question or comment directly on the relevant page in the SAP Help Portal if you wish‚Äîthe choice is yours. By the way, talking of the SAP BTP Developers Guide, this has had some updates and improvements recently. There's a new strengths and benefits section for all major runtimes, there's a new security guide with info for all the different relevant aspects or development phases of CAP development. And there's also a new section on developing software-as-a-service offerings, especially interesting, I suppose, for SAP partners and other software vendors. Anyway, have a look at the documentation and get involved.

[Tom] You might have noticed that the SAP Developer News was a little lighter this week. Well, that's probably because next week is SAP TechEd. And of course, who would have news about a new release or a new feature coming out just the week before TechEd? Of course, we're going to have tons of news from SAP TechEd virtual and Berlin and TechEd on tour. So be on the lookout for special episodes of the SAP Developer News next week, live from Berlin. We will bring you all the updates and announcements from the event. But speaking of SAP TechEd, we also have the Community Voice. And this is a new offering, kind of a monthly newsletter format to keep you abreast of all things that are going on in the SAP community. This month, they have a lot of information to help you get ready for TechEd and get the most out of it. They also have a wrap-up of Devtoberfest, information about new certifications, blog highlights, all kinds of good content. So be sure to check that out. Make a great thing to read as you're getting ready to travel to SAP TechEd or SAP TechEd on tour. And if you are going to be there in Berlin next week or Sydney or India later in the month, we look forward to seeing you there. So until then, have a great trip and a great TechEd.

entry.title: My Expert Playlist - SAP TechEd 2025
entry.content:
Hello, dear influencers, experts, and friends from the SAP Community!

It‚Äôs finally that time of the year again: SAP TechEd Season!
This year feels extra special to me‚Äîit‚Äôs the first SAP TechEd happening in Germany since I moved here, and I couldn‚Äôt be more excited.

When it comes to building my personal TechEd agenda, it has never been both so easy and so difficult at the same time.

Why difficult?
Because my curiosity is endless. Over my (long) SAP career, I‚Äôve worked across many areas: from writing ABAP code to designing modern user interfaces, from integration to solution and enterprise architecture‚Äîwhere technology truly meets business. I love exploring how technology and business merge, so naturally, I‚Äôd like to attend almost every session across the board.

Why easy?
Because priorities are clear this year: AI.
My laser focus will be on everything around custom AI scenarios‚Äîhow we as engineers can build AI extensions, create and extend Joule AI agents, and leverage the SAP AI Foundation. I believe many of the new challenges (and opportunities!) will emerge here, and I can‚Äôt wait to discover how SAP‚Äôs newest innovations will empower us.

That said, I‚Äôve shortlisted around 30 sessions I‚Äôd love to attend. Realistically, some I‚Äôll have to catch later via SAP TechEd Virtual‚Äîbut here are my Top 3 ‚Äúmust-watch‚Äù sessions:

 

My Top 3 SAP TechEd 2025 Sessions

  • CT1245 | Hugging Face Transformers in AI Foundation
    I‚Äôm learning to use Hugging Face models, so I‚Äôm curious to see how they work within the SAP AI Foundation. This feels like a new superpower for building advanced AI scenarios.

  • AI160 | Build your own AI agent‚Äìbased solution with the generative AI hub
    Agents are another game-changing technology. Spending two hours diving deep into building custom AI agents to extend SAP products sounds like time very well invested.

  • PAR102 | From MCP to Joule: Unlocking SAP data and AI innovation with Microsoft
    I‚Äôve been exploring how SAP AI Foundation can be integrated with cloud providers beyond the Generative AI Hub. This session will be a great opportunity to hear directly from Microsoft experts on their approach.

  • Bonus: AI101 | Optimize prompts and explore models with the generative AI hub
    Prompt engineering is one of the core skills for creating effective custom AI solutions. This session promises plenty of practical insights to sharpen that skill.

Of course, I wish I could attend everything‚Äîbut thankfully, many sessions will be available later via SAP TechEd Virtual.

In addition to the AI-focused ones, I‚Äôll also keep a close eye on all sessions related to Joule in the context of ABAP and CAP development‚Äîbecause at the end of the day, AI custom scenarios often start right there (with a little help from Python).

Final Thoughts

To all my fellow SAP Community colleagues:
I wish you an inspiring and knowledge-packed SAP TechEd season. May your curiosity be fueled and your learning appetite at least partly satisfied.

Let‚Äôs keep in touch and exchange our learnings in the weeks to come.

All the best,
Douglas

entry.title: JOIN US: Meet SAP HANA Cloud @ SAP TechEd 2025
entry.content:
Hi there! If you care about turning data into real business advantage, this one‚Äôs for you. TechEd airs next Tuesday, and our SAP HANA Cloud track is built to spark ideas, answer your toughest database and AI questions, and get you hands-on with the tools you‚Äôll use tomorrow. Join us in Berlin or online! We‚Äôd love to meet you!

üîπ Why this matters to you

  • If you‚Äôre responsible for data strategy, cloud architecture, or AI-enabled apps, SAP HANA Cloud is a central part of SAP‚Äôs Business Technology Platform and Business Data Cloud.
  • Expect practical takeaways: built-in AI capabilities, vector search and knowledge graphs, elastic compute for scale, and patterns for keeping your S/4HANA core clean while innovating fast.
  • This is more than theory ‚Äî roadmap sessions and hands-on workshops show what‚Äôs coming in 2025 and beyond and how to apply it right away.

üîπ Meet the experts and join our sessions (onsite in Berlin ‚Äî quick guide)

  • ST115 ‚Äî Strategy Talk: ‚ÄúSAP HANA Cloud: The Database for Business AI‚Äù
    Nov 5, 2:15‚Äì2:40 PM CET
    A high-level look at how SAP HANA Cloud supports analytics, multi-model processing, ML and generative AI ‚Äî and where we‚Äôre going next.
  • DA817 ‚Äî Roadmap Session: ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs Next for SAP HANA Cloud: Roadmap and Innovation Highlights‚Äù
    Nov 6, 1:30‚Äì1:55 PM CET
    Roadmap reveals: generative AI toolkit, tabular AI functions, and features to connect your data to AI agents.
  • DA200 ‚Äî Deep Dive: ‚ÄúHelp future-proof your database landscape with SAP HANA Cloud"
    Nov 5, 10:15‚Äì11:00 AM CET
    Architecture-focused deep dive: elastic compute, file-based architectures, knowledge graphs, and integration patterns, to prepare your data landscape for the future.
  • DA201 ‚Äî Deep Dive: ‚ÄúAccelerating your AI strategy with SAP HANA Cloud‚Äù
    Nov 6, 9:00‚Äì9:45 AM CET
    How the In-Database AI, vector engine and knowledge graph engine enable context-rich AI scenarios via SAP HANA Cloud and SAP BTP.
  • DA202 ‚Äî Deep Dive: ‚ÄúExtensibility at scale: Building intelligent applications with SAP HANA Cloud‚Äù
    Nov 5, 1:15‚Äì2:00 PM CET
    Real-world approaches to clean-core extensibility using CAP and SAP Build Code.
  • DA261 ‚Äî Hands On: ‚ÄúUnlocking AI-driven insights from your business data in SAP HANA Cloud‚Äù
    Nov 4, 12:30‚Äì2:30 PM CET
    Hands-on focussing on working with tabular AI, similarity search, and RAG using the knowledge graph engine.
